intro: Lagynias rufescens subsp. angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lagynias, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its narrow, linear leaves are a distinguishing feature, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
